The DocBook framework supports the following two table model layouts:
CALS table model
HTML table model

section.title: CALS Table Model Layout
section.note: A sample plugin is available that can be used as inspiration to add support for CALS tables in any XML document: Sample Plugin: Add CALS Support for any XML Document.

section.title: HTML Table Model Layout
section.p: Choosing an HTML table model from the Insert Table dialog box in a DocBook document inserts a formal (captioned) HTML table. The layout of an HTML table includes a section above the table that allows you to easily configure some properties without opening the Table Properties dialog box. For example, you can change the value of column widths (width attribute) or the text alignment (align attribute). Although these properties appear as part of the Author mode, they will not appear in your output. They are just there to make it easier to adjust how the columns of your table are formatted.

section.title: Pasting Tables in DocBook
section.p:
Tables that are pasted into a DocBook file are automatically converted to the CALS model. If you want to overwrite this behavior and instruct to convert them to HTML tables, set the docbook.html.table parameter to 1. You can find this parameter in the following stylesheet:
/frameworks/docbook/resources/xhtml2db5Driver.xsl for DocBook 5
/frameworks/docbook/resources/xhtml2db4Driver.xsl for DocBook 4
